website_summaries.verdict: Pick and mattock blade combine to make this heavyweight 5-lb. mattock solid, functional, and highly durable.
pros: Rubber handle grip encases the double inject fiberglass handle
Notable for its great action, which makes it easy to work with for long periods with a great balance
cons: Users report the head can slip from the handle after long periods of use

customer_reviews.title: solid and well constructed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired manufacturer of aircraft systems and very critical of products I buy. So I sorted through the many competitors and selected this one for lightweight, long-lasting fiberglass handle. I have used this a number of times for the last several months and am completely satisfied with this pick/mattock. I usually have suggestions for improvement, but this seems simple, well constructed and hard to improve upon. I would buy it again and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas James

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Pick Mattock for trail work on the Appalachian Trail
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding tool, very well made, well balanced, and perfect for the trail work I do on the Appalachian Trail in SW Massachusetts. Its always a tossup between fiberglass and wood, and between 2.5 lbs and 5 lbs. The heavier the tool, the tougher it is to carry it in and the more tired one gets using it all day. The weight of this tool is perfect for trail work. I maintain 12 miles of the Appalachian Trail with dozens of water bars to keep cleaned out. This is the perfect tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wanderman

customer_reviews.title: Well made! And lasts... I've had it over 3 years now
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. It's sturdy and very well made. It's the perfect weight too. This one has a rubber grip that a lot of picks don't have. And the fiberglass handle makes a huge difference in that it's light and super-durable. This pick will last a lifetime I'm betting. Update: I've added several pics now. I've now had this tool for over 3 years now, with pretty frequent use, and it stands the test of time. I always read reviews before purchasing, and find some quite helpful, so I hope you find this review helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Durable, and No Splinters from the Handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made, durable pick axe. Where I live we have clay based soil and it is nearly impossible to shovel when you want to plant something. A landscaper tipped me off that a pick axe would break it up or dig holes much easier, so I bought this. I was looking for a somewhat lighter axe and thought the fiberglass handle would make this one lighter. I didn't feel a big difference in weight - this one weighs in around 8 lbs., but at least you don't get splinters with this handle like you do with an older axe. Great axe overall, and I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: TexasG

customer_reviews.title: looks quite used
customer_reviews.text: it seem's like a decent mattock. i mostly purchased it for the handle. the item is very much not new like it states on the website. there are blemishes, gouges in the handle, finger prints and grease on the handle, and some paint chipping from use. but i'm not going to put it in a glass case, I plan on getting it dirty, so i'm giving it three stars. the handle feels good. hopefully it hold up with Colorado clays.
customer_reviews.author: connor

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Yard Tool
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite yard tool for planting shrubs and removing roots from my garden! Very sturdy, very light, easy grip even with my arthritis and gets the job done quickly. I have red clay to deal with any time I'm planting and this tool is the BEST - wish I had purchased one years ago. The only reason I gave it four stars is because the wooden handle gave me splinters in both hands right when I took it out of the box. After sanding it was perfect. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Good balance - effective in tough clay
customer_reviews.text: This tool seems to be the perfect tool for breaking up my tough clay-like ground in areas where I need to 'regrade' a bit for winter runoff control. It's easier for me to use than something like a digging bar to loosen otherwise impossible to loosen subsoil. I have several acres where it will continue to come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: luerwulf

customer_reviews.title: still intact
customer_reviews.text: I guess I have had this long enough to say that it is holding up, still doing what is was made. I have been using it for digging in very compact soil to dig up roots and whatever I happen to find down there with them. My only "complaint" is that no matter how well these thing are made, they still depend on human muscle power to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: J. Streit

customer_reviews.title: Strong, built to last
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good and strong railroad pick. it is well designed and has a good feel when you hit the ground, I used it on some really hard ground and it broke the hard ground apart. I would recommend this tool for anyone who has to break up ground, or rocks. This tool is going to last.
customer_reviews.author: markld

customer_reviews.title: I paid full price for this item.
customer_reviews.text: I paid full price for this item. I bought this for my daughter, who was digging her own french drain around her garage and little house; my workhorse 5-lb mattock has somehow come up missing. It turns out that the 2.5 lb was more than sufficient to get her ditches dug before rainy season hit. I think I'll buy one for myself and skip replacing the 5 lb.
customer_reviews.author: Maura Enright

customer_reviews.title: Consider the  Truper 31638 5-Pound Cutter Mattock
customer_reviews.text: This has a pick (the sharp pointy end) and a mattock (the wide hoe end). The 5 Lb weight does the work so you just lift it and drop it. Just take small cuts and you can dig and cut through roots you could not do with a shovel. After using this, I got the Axe and Mattock version so I could more easily cut roots going across the trenches for irrigation pipes.
customer_reviews.author: BillT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pick axe.  The right tool for many jobs.  This is a good one.
customer_reviews.text: This is just right for my purposes. It is relatively light weight for a pick axe. Well built. Sturdy. That's what I need. When my neighbor saw my pick axe, he said: "I thought about buying one of those--but I was afraid I would be tempted to use it." Meaning, of course, that using a pick axe is lots of work. Which it can be. But it is the right tool for lots of things. When a pick axe is the right tool, it is less work than anything else--any wrong tool.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Niell Donovan

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice well made tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice well made tool. I use it quite a bit. The only downside is that the 5lb head gets quite heavy after a bit of use. The handle is also a little short, so you have to bend over while using it. If I bought it again I would probably buy the version with the lighter head.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Very Tough
customer_reviews.text: The ad copy is misleading. It says this tool cuts roots and breaks up hard soil. In reality, it does nothing unless you swing it. Other than that, I am very happy with it. I bought a mattock at Home Depot, and one blade was so flimsy it was easy to bend permanently. Total junk. This Truper is heavy-duty. Don't buy it unless you're in shape. It's a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Not 2 1/2 Pounds
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mattock. I like it. But it's not lightweight. I haven't weighed it, but I'd guess it's around 10 pounds or so. Weight ratings for mattocks may have odd features that I'm not aware of. But forget about the advertised 2 1/2 pounds for this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pick-mattock
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this to break up some asphalt along my garage, and choosing the lighter pick was a smart move. I can use this one continuously without getting tired. I also have a 5 pound mattock/cutter from Truper, and that one forces me to stop every several strokes, or go a lot more slowly. Buy the lighter one—you’ll be happy you did. Both are good quality metal and the fiberglass handles are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K.

customer_reviews.title: Eh, not the best. Not the worst.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best pick axe. But by no means the worst. I think I will saw the pick off and just use the axe. And then it will be perfect. But, idk the shape of it just seems odd for my earth moving uses.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Shaw

customer_reviews.title: its a pick alright....
customer_reviews.text: its a pick..... i already used this to dig a trench about my house to install a french drain. it held up pretty good, price is about the same if you were going to purchase one from home depot but with Amazon prime i don't have to deal with the lines and had it delivered to my house. good buy
customer_reviews.author: darizo99

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pickaxe -
customer_reviews.text: i used the 2-1/2-Pound Mattock Pickaxe on the "tough spots" while digging a 150'x18" trench for a french drain. in one part of the trench, i found i would need to cut through about 4-6" of granite bedrock for about 6-8'. between a sledgehammer (crush/fracture), a hammerdrill/masonry drill bits (directing cracks), and this pickaxe (precision fracture/leveraging), i was able to make short order of the bedrock. were this ever to break (i can't imagine how, after seeing what it's capable of standing up to), i would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Camera Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Mexican manufacturing company that doesn't have a working system for submitting warranty claims.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and my gardener used it only a few times before the handle became separated from the blade. Note that the manufacturer (Truper) is a Mexican company. I tried to make a warranty claim on the English version of their website but all I get is a URL not recognized message when I try to submit the claim. I can handle a tool breaking if there is a company behind it that honors their warranty. In this case I can't even submit a warranty claim.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D.

customer_reviews.title: Quite heavy
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet, but it looks about right for the job. Tilling it not practical for raised beds, so I'm trying a new method. Saw someone on cable using this in a period 1950-ish program to slam down and rustle the soil...seemed like it was working for him. For me, the weight might limit how much I can do with it for softening hardened raised bed soils. I'm not very big. ;)
customer_reviews.author: ZED

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it will last at most digging g. Great product
customer_reviews.text: The handle is crazy hardwood. It was a task drilling and bolting a magnet to the end for creek hunting.
customer_reviews.author: william s, yohn

customer_reviews.title: I also use it to dig out unwanted plants like poison oak and black berries
customer_reviews.text: Digging on my property is an issue. It laughs at shovels. This thing though makes the laughing stop right away. I also use it to dig out unwanted plants like poison oak and black berries.
customer_reviews.author: Yuppa

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool but both came somewhat damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Had to send the first one back for a replacement. The handle had several deep gouges in the middle. It's a fiberglass handle so it's not easy to put gouges in that type of handle. The replacement mattock had shallow gouges near the head that I do not believe will affect the durability of this tool. Otherwise it is a great tool. Already used it. Very effective on packed dirt, rocky soil. Feels very powerful like it could rip through anything!!! Only 4 stars due to the shipping problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dennys Casimir Novak

customer_reviews.title: Nothing wrong with this Pic Mattock
customer_reviews.text: Well made great tool to have around the yard. Not to heavy that it wears you out, but heavy enough to do some damage if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: JMichaelPed

customer_reviews.title: this was pathetic. My new Truper 31614 5-pound pick-mattock with an ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pick-axe. I actually had two, but both had eighteen inch handles. For someone with back and leg problems, this was pathetic. My new Truper 31614 5-pound pick-mattock with an adult size handle is much better. This is a strong tool with good vibration dampening. The handle is plastic, covered in a rubberized coating and is permanently sealed to the head.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was four stars, could have been five.
customer_reviews.text: Upon further inspection, it is not only the wrong tool, it is used. My earlier review was rejected for some reason. I got a tool that was different than was described. It is a quality tool. It moves dirt. I do like it. It works well. The fact that it is used and different than specified is the reason for the average review.
customer_reviews.author: spence

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Able to complete a huge back yard project with the right tool Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Coelho

customer_reviews.title: Great for chopping ice!
customer_reviews.text: Used this winter for chopping ice at the end of my driveway and it worked great! Well made!
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: it works good
customer_reviews.text: good weight solid. the rubber on the handle my tear if bang it up to much, but still solid pick
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: This was great in helping me break up some very hard
customer_reviews.text: This was great in helping me break up some very hard, impacted dirt in my garden. Would recommend for anyone having the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: OJ

customer_reviews.title: Tough and Cuts the Rock
customer_reviews.text: This is the one you want if you need to trench in rocky terrain. Tough and cuts the rock.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Rebel

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for do it yourself gardeners
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a great help in digging up roots, and I am 73, female, 99# . Has been a tremendous help in getting rid of out of control berry bushes in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Had a 30+ year old pampas grass that I couldn’t remove with dynamite or pulling with a truck. This was recommended and after 2 hours of use that area was completely cleared of all pampas and roots. I’ve used it for stump removal as well. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A Klier

customer_reviews.title: Well made, tough and very well balanced.
customer_reviews.text: Just like a double bladed ax, I love the feel of this mattock as I slam it into the dirt. Very well balanced, easy to hold onto and it make my job go so much easier! Wish shovel's could be this tough!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Weber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and gets the job done. Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Quincy G. Riddick

customer_reviews.title: Really well made and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Amazing unit and the price was right. My husband has pulled up about 10 smaller tree/large shrub stumps so far with this and he couldnt have done it without it.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Terry

customer_reviews.title: Easy transaction and product came fast, seems like a solid product and works quite well!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy transaction and product came fast, seems like a solid product and works quite well!!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Got here fast, have given it plenty of abuse and still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: big, strong, very helpful tool in the arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I will always splurge on tools that might save my back. This tool is strong and does the work for you with a long handle and heavy head. It paid for itself pretty quickly and the fiberglass handle is easy on the hands.
customer_reviews.author: KenP

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice but bent the blade after a couple of hard days of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great pick mattock
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like buying the right tool for the job. This is my first mattock, and it works great. Looks better that the local box store models I was considering, and it doesn't look like the head can fall off the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P

customer_reviews.title: Pick did the job.
customer_reviews.text: Handle will not hold up for very heavy work. Had light work for the garden. Sharp enough. Worked fine. Balanced. Very good price point. Prime delivered in a couple days. Worked fine. I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: DT Biggie

customer_reviews.title: Miners gold
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good pick to tackle some very rocky soils where a shoved did not make a dent. This did the job. After reading the reviews, I agree this pick is well made and the handle is light weight but solid. I'm very happy with this purchase...just wish it was made in the U.S A. instead of Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: Suzz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pick and I honestly believe it will break me before I can break it!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Husband loved it
customer_reviews.text: This worked incredibly well for my husband. He spent the summer digging up the roots of wild (non-native) blackberry bushes that completely took over our backyard. We saved a ton of money doing this ourselves prior to a big landscaping project, and it was better than using pesticides.
customer_reviews.author: ESFJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool exactly what we needed. No wooden handle to break
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Barker

customer_reviews.title: The perfect tool for digging in Alabama red clay
customer_reviews.text: The perfect tool for digging in Alabama red clay, made preparing planting holes for trees pretty easy compared to near impossible with just a shovel. Arrived when promised in perfect condition. Met and exceeded expectations at a price, delivered to my house, less than in any local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Raytriarch

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavily constructed. Cut through hard packed dry clay like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice.
customer_reviews.text: Another great tool that has improved over the old age stuff. Lightweight, yet dense and efficient. Well balanced and easy to hold and pick with vibration.
customer_reviews.author: MARK A. DESALVO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through tree roots and allows work that would be impossible without this pick...
customer_reviews.author: Dennwins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING product!!! Was very well made. Bought two other tools by the same manufacturer - love them all!
customer_reviews.author: GEOFnCARYN

customer_reviews.title: This tool is a back saver
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. Both ends are very sharp, which is just what I needed.It was delivered quickly and boxed carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have crap rocky top soil. Thus cuts right through it
customer_reviews.author: Ben B. Photography

customer_reviews.title: Can't Garden Without It!
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for gardening. It works like a charm and you can't garden without this handy-dandy gardening tool.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great "trenching tool" for short irrigation runs in confined spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Well built and worked great. I did sharpen the flat edge, but that wasn't really necessary.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very strong
customer_reviews.text: This product did an excellent job and stood up to punishment from me. I had already broken one of these from another company doing this task(pulling out bush roots) and this one didn't even bend.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once so far but it is sturdy and gets the job done. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: It held up well and worked great. Hosed down and still looks like new
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to dig some trenches in rocky soil. It held up well and worked great. Hosed down and still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Great mattock. Very sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great mattock. Very sturdy and durable. I use it almost daily on my ranch breaking up rocky soil. I think I'll buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 'Tis a pick-axe. Broke my wooden handle, so I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I'm buying another one.
customer_reviews.text: We dig with picks as seldom as possible but that is quite often. This is the best one. Used it to chop through 3" tree roots also. Very sharp out of the package. I'm buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Concrete Man

customer_reviews.title: Good balance and weight
customer_reviews.text: Good balance and weight. I really like fiberglass handles over wood. I think this helps balance the tool make it easier to work with. More comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the wide chisel side of this pick! It chops through one inch or smaller roots pretty easily. Very nice when picking dirt near a tree!
customer_reviews.author: kdog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What I needed and wanted and gets the job done, heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Rabbi H

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pick Axe
customer_reviews.text: Nice pick axe for the price. Fiberglass handle feels good in the hands. Not as heavy as some I've had, which is nice for those of us with back problems doing lighter work.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: He loved it and it has help up well
customer_reviews.text: This is all my 13 year old grandson wanted for his birthday to take camping in the desert. He loved it and it has help up well.
customer_reviews.author: Berryknoll.

customer_reviews.title: Really works great at breaking up this rock hard ground we are ...
customer_reviews.text: Really works great at breaking up this rock hard ground we are landscaping and has feel of an exceptionally well made Pick Mattock.
customer_reviews.author: would like to comment

customer_reviews.title: workhorse
customer_reviews.text: just feels like a quality product. good weight, but not heavy. handle has a great grip, is relatively light and forgiving. it flexes just enough so you that if you hit a rock, you don't get jarred up your arms. happy so far
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious pick. I've used it on some butt kicking jobs and it always come through. She's big and heavy, if you're into that kinda thing.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool to break up dirt
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool to break up dirt. being a female, it is not too heavy for me to pick up and swing.
customer_reviews.author: janie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Good Quality. Seems to do the job.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to. Digs out the hard compacted rock filled soil to be shoveled up. Nice manual labor tool.
customer_reviews.author: adam6979

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty pick axe
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty pick axe, however it is not very secure on handle. Some glue and a hammer to lock it in place have it on good now though.
customer_reviews.author: Hat and gloves

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Piece of Steel
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pick axe, pretty heavy and sturdy. I'm pretty sure it's heaver than 5 lbs more like 10 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Reimund

customer_reviews.title: HANDY tool!
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy, heavy tool is a great help when trying to dig holes in heavy clay soil. That's all it's been used for thus far - but am glad to have it in the gardening collection!
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: I would love to get a replacement
customer_reviews.text: This was working well until it just randomly fell apart after just a few days of use. I would love to get a replacement, but I can't find information on the seller. It makes me question if I would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Wood

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: just the right weight and I like the fiberglass handle. got it right away
customer_reviews.author: Arriba Doychee

customer_reviews.title: It is a good strong tool
customer_reviews.text: It is a good strong tool, it arrived well packaged and in ready to work condition it has a very nice handle and grip and is well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Heavier then advertised though!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, not. 2 1/2 pounds though? It's more like 9 pounds! Thank you! TW
customer_reviews.author: TESS

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for what its designed for
customer_reviews.text: I used this to tear up 50 square feet of roots and small brush. Chopped right through roots up to about 1-1/2". Pick worked great for leverage as well .I'm glad I bought a fiberglass handle over wood.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Metal portion disconnected from the plastic handle. I've only used it a couple times.
customer_reviews.author: russ75

customer_reviews.title: Excelent tool
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be an excelent purchase, great for digging .
customer_reviews.author: Brian Toomire

customer_reviews.title: sturdy pick
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but strong. Dug a 2' hole in an old driveway in a half hour. A mattock was of no use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morey

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use..have already been chopping ice with it! Good grip handle and just the right length.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and  it works
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, well made and does the job. A must for digging trenches and breaking up hard soil.
customer_reviews.author: Nyfiken

customer_reviews.title: tough tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool with a nice grip. I use it to dig in the hard lay soil here. Be careful and wear goggles when digging ground with lots of rocks because it will split the rocks in half!
customer_reviews.author: C. SHI

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good tool to have for the home. Heavy is a benefit, but works well.
customer_reviews.author: Americhanka

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Good balance and weight. Does the job and still as good as new. Will out last me without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: georg

customer_reviews.title: A very solid tool. This weight is substantial to ...
customer_reviews.text: A very solid tool. This weight is substantial to cut through tough compacted soil, but not too heavy so you can keep working. Optimum for tough jobs. This tool gets through most roots and makes short work of tough soil.
customer_reviews.author: Mzungu Jim

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pick, if it lasts then I'll bump it up from 4 to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Miner 49er Would Be Jealous
customer_reviews.text: Awesome addition to my Zombie Eradication Kit. It also helps dig holes.
customer_reviews.author: ColdWarMarine

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding tool. Well made, and heavy enough to dig with
customer_reviews.author: Carole R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide blade for cutting roots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pick ax to loosen up earth with a lot of roots in it. I needed something that was sharp and wide enough to cut through roots, which this tool did perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great pick and mattock for digging. Durable and takes the punishment.
customer_reviews.author: J. Seiple

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. used for digging and breaking asphalt
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Tough, functional, worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: They didn't carry a pick this big at my local big-box store, so I picked this one up based on other reviews. It isn't a complicated tool, and it brings no new invention to the task of general yard work, but it does appear to be durable, has the proper weight/handle length/head shape and is very functional for trenching and digging projects in my back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R. Earnhardt

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through compressed dirt
customer_reviews.text: Used mattock to clean a goat pen. The hay and organic material in the pen accumulates over months and becomes knotted and knit together into something between a brick and a bog. Using hoe and shovel is slow and painstaking. The mattock sliced through the buildup like a hot knife through butter. The adze end rips out chunks. The pick end disentagles. A job that before took technique and muscle now becomes almost play.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Orlow

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it twice, but it cut through the dirt with ease.
customer_reviews.author: a reader

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. The handle absorbs a lot of shock and the construction is done well so the tool does not detach from the handle. Looked as good as new after 3 days of intense work.
customer_reviews.author: Mc

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Had to dig a trench for my water main in my front yard. Went through HARD clay, concrete and rock. Love the handle. Yeah its heavy on the end... its supposed to be. Get off the couch once in a while and it is not that hard to swing.
customer_reviews.author: TKIN
